intro: Jossinia tinifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf jossinia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and its distinctive silvery-gray leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Jossinia tinifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
